summary: Internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) regarding updated press remarks and Q&A documents related to the Epstein case, sent by a Public Affairs staff member to colleagues for review before passing to superiors.

persons.name: Public Affairs
persons.role: Public Affairs staff member at U.S. Attorney's Office
persons.context: Sender of the email, responsible for preparing updated press remarks and Q&A documents regarding the Epstein case and requesting review before passing to superiors.

events.title: Preparation of Updated Epstein Press Materials
events.description: Public Affairs staff at SDNY circulates updated proposed press remarks and Q&A documents related to the Epstein case for internal review before distribution to leadership.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively preparing press materials (remarks and Q&A) related to the Epstein case in July 2019.
The email indicates internal coordination and review processes within the SDNY regarding public communications about the Epstein case.
The sender refers to the case as 'Amazing case,' suggesting internal commentary on its high-profile nature.
The document shows the timing of press preparation shortly before Epstein's arrest on July 6, 2019.
